channel.title: Comments on: Write Like You’re Running Out of Time (Because You’re 30 Now)
channel.description: Stellar Short Fiction by Women-Identified Writers Since 2010

item.title: By: Aphotic Ink
item.dc:creator: Aphotic Ink
item.description: I've got no trouble tuning out the transcription of HetPet, and the ending was lovely... but ooof. The whole thing about "allow an old woman her theatrics" felt like it was really leaning into the whole "hey YOU! did you know you were DECREPIT? did you know that even people who call out ageism buy into the idea that thirty is OLD?"

item.title: By: Karen Anderson
item.dc:creator: Karen Anderson
item.description: I'm sad that this well-intentioned essay perpetuates some harmful and hurtful stereotypes about age along the way. Yes, I know you are being humorous about the tiredness and the midday nap. But, please! I'm 66, work full time, and find a good Zumba workout is better than a nap. I think you may be discovering, as I have, that the most exhausting thing about aging is...battling ageism. I have the advantage of seeing that about 90 percent of the "bright young things" who raced past me in my 20s have vanished completely from the (incredibly fickle and easily bored) public eye. Hang in there.
